text: Major Mercer, the commander of the Worcestershire horse, played a significant part in the Battle of Worcester in 1651, but although mentioned in primary sources his full name is not given in them. noted in David Laing speculated that he was John Mercer the younger brother of William Mercer who was also a parliamentary officer and author of "Angliae Speculum, or England's looking- glass" (London 1646).Not to be confused with England's looking-glass by Edmund Calamy the Elder (London 1642) ==Notes== ==References== * * * * Category:Military history of Worcestershire Category:English soldiers Category:Roundheads Category:Year of birth missing Category:Year of death missing
title: Major Mercer of the Worcestershire horse
